question.title: Does ShowCodeDetailsInExceptionMessages impact performance in Java?
question.body:
Is there any performance impact on a Java program if we enable ShowCodeDetailsInExceptionMessages flag?

Since JVM has to do extra tasks to print the reason when the code throws NullPointerException, will it cause any performance impact on a program?

answers.body:
The usual answer is of course: it depends.

So, Yes it will add some overhead. Usually, that effect should be negligible. BUT if your application is throwing a lot of exceptions then this will definitely have a bigger impact.

In general, throwing exceptions is slow and should only be done if it really is an exception. So if your logic is not "exception driven" (don't laugh, I've seen that several times in projects) you should not see a big impact.

question_comments.body: It will only impact the printing of the exception message which will happen rarely, compared to the programâ€™s normal operation.

It might impact performance, but throwing exceptions in general will have a far greater effect on performance. Assembling a stack trace for an exception is a slow process. If you are catching NullPointerException, you should immediately stop doing it, and use code like if (value == null) instead. Even better practice is to avoid null values as much as possible; for example, do not accept null as a synonym for an empty Collection, Map, or array.
Please have a look at this essay, it says it does impact the performance

What version of the Java JDK are you using? According to the official docs for JDK 17, docs.oracle.com/en/java/javase/17/docs/specs/man/java.html, ShowCodeDetailsInExceptionMessages is enabled by default.
